intro: Cleome bicolor, commonly known as the spider flower, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the southeastern United States. It features striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple, often with a distinctive, spidery appearance. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soils. Cleome bicolor is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
